Articles.Content: I thought i remembered Scott Manley mention a key command that would force green construction nodes to snap together.  I'm trying to attach a probe to the docking port in my cargo bay, but the game isn't giving me any attachment, even when it's in the exact place it should be.
Hold alt, editor will disable surface attach, then click. Note this doesn't solve the problem of parts being red and unattachable - that's a separate problem.

Obligatory link to the Key Bindings page of the KSP Wiki.

Happy landings!

If you've saved the probe as a separate ship, you must save it so that the part you want to attach (typically a docking port, or the engine or a separator) is the root part of the craft and has a spare attachment node. Then you can merge it in and attach it to the spare node.

If it's a subassembly, the part where you want to attach it must be the part that you grabbed in order to separate it off in order to save it as a subassembly (... hope that that is clear...).

16 minutes ago, Plusck said:

If you've saved the probe as a separate ship, you must save it so that the part you want to attach (typically a docking port, or the engine or a separator) is the root part of the craft and has a spare attachment node.

Actually, you don't have to. By knowing that shift-click can tear apart an inactive/red ship, you can merge a ship with no node. Just merge and shift-click a part away from its root - you'll now have half of the ship with a node on your cursor ready for attaching, and the other half with the root node open now.
